summary: Chordoma is a rare, slow-growing cancer that originates from cellular remnants of the notochord, typically found in the skull base and spine. It is a type of bone cancer classified as a sarcoma, and while sometimes mistaken for brain or spinal cord tumors due to its location, it does not arise from nervous tissue.
causes: Duplication of the brachyury gene (familial form)
treatments: Radiation therapy (proton therapy, carbon ion therapy)
